text: M'banza-Kongo (known as SÃ£o Salvador in Portuguese from 1570 to 1975), is a town in northwesternAngola. It is the capital of Zaire Province. In the valley to the south is the Luezi River. M'banza-Kongo was once the home of the Manikongo, the ruler of the Kingdom of Kongo. == References == Category:Cities in Angola Category:1570s establishments Category:Establishments in Angola
title: M'banza-Kongo
